arabicText: ۞ وَلَا تُجَـٰدِلُوٓا۟ أَهْلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِلَّا بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَقُولُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْنَا وَأُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ وَإِلَـٰهُنَا وَإِلَـٰهُكُمْ وَٰحِدٌۭ وَنَحْنُ لَهُۥ مُسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	O	Muslims,	do	not	argue	with	the	
People	given	the	Book(s)	except	in	the	
best	manner	–	except	(with)	those	among	
them	who	oppress,	and	say,	“We	believe	
in	what	has	been	sent	down	towards	us	
and	what	has	been	sent	towards	you	–	
and	ours	and	your	God	is	One,	and	we	
have	submitted	ourselves	to	Him.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Musalmāno!	Kitābiyoñ	se	na	
jhagdo magar	behtar	ṭariqe	par	magar	
woh jinhoñ	ne	un	meiñ	se	zulm	kiyā	aur	
kaho	ham	Imān	lāye	us	par	jo	hamāri	ṭaraf	
utrā	aur	jo	tumhāri	ṭaraf	utrā	aur	hamārā	
aik	m’abood	hai	aur	ham	us	ke	ḥuzoor	
garden	rakhe	haiñ.

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۖ وَمِنْ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِهِۦ ۚ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَّا ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	this	is	how	We	sent	down	the	Book	to	
you	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him);	so	those	to	
whom	We	gave	the	Book	believe	in	it;	and	
some	of	these	(polytheists)	accept	faith	in	
it;	and	none	except	the	disbelievers	reject	
Our	signs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Meḥboob	yuñ hi	tumhāri	ṭaraf	
Kitāb	utāri	to	woh	jinheñ	ham	ne	kitāb	‘aṭā	
farmāi	us	par	Imān	lāte	haiñ	aur	kuch	un	
meiñ	se	haiñ	jo	us	par	Imān	late	haiñ	aur	
hamāri	āayatoñ	se	munkir	nahiñ	hote	
magar	kāfir.

arabicText: وَمَا كُنتَ تَتْلُوا۟ مِن قَبْلِهِۦ مِن كِتَـٰبٍۢ وَلَا تَخُطُّهُۥ بِيَمِينِكَ ۖ إِذًۭا لَّٱرْتَابَ ٱلْمُبْطِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	were	not	
reading	any	Book	before	it,	nor	writing	
with	your	right	hand	–	if	it	were,	the	
people	of	falsehood	would	surely	have	
doubted.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	is	se	pahle	tum	koi	Kitāb	na	padhte	
the	aur	na	apne	hath	se	kuch	likhte	the	
yuñ	hotā	to	bāṭil	wale	zaror	shak	lāte.

arabicText: بَلْ هُوَ ءَايَـٰتٌۢ بَيِّنَـٰتٌۭ فِى صُدُورِ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ ۚ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَّا ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	fact	they	are	clear	verses	in	the	hearts	
of	those	who	have	been	given	knowledge;	
and	none	deny	Our	verses	except	the	
unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	woh roshan	āayateñ	haiñ	un	ke	
sinoñ	meiñ	jin	ko	‘ilm	diyā	gayā	aur	hamāri	āayatoñ	kā	inkār	nahiñ	karte	magar	zālim.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۖ قُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌ
englishTranslationText:
In	fact	they	are	clear	verses	in	the	hearts	
of	those	who	have	been	given	knowledge;	
and	none	deny	Our	verses	except	the	
unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
And	they	said,	“Why	did	not	signs	come	
down	to	him	from	his	Lord?”	Say,	“Signs	are	only	with	Allah;	and	I	am	purely	a	Herald	of	plain	
warning.”

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَكْفِهِمْ أَنَّآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَرَحْمَةًۭ وَذِكْرَىٰ لِقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Is	it	not	enough	for	them	that	We	have	sent	down	the	Book	upon	you,	which	is	read	to	them?	
Indeed	in	it	are	mercy	and	advice	for	the	Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	kiyoñ	na	utreñ	kuch	nishāniyāñ	un	par	un	ke	rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	tum	farmāo	nishāniyāñ	to	
Allāh	hi	ke	pās	haiñ	aur	meiñ	to	yahi	sāf	dar	sunāne	wālā	hooñ.

arabicText: قُلْ كَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكُمْ شَهِيدًۭا ۖ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ وَكَفَرُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“Allah	is	Sufficient	as	a	
Witness	between	me	and	you;	He	knows	all	what	is	in	the	heavens	and	in	the	earth;	and	those	
who	accepted	faith	in	falsehood	and	denied	faith	in	Allah	–	it	is	they	who	are	the	losers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	ye	unheñ	bas	nahiñ	ke	ham	ne	tum	par	kitāb	utāri	jo	un	par	padhi	jati	hai	be-shak	us	
meiñ	raḥmat	aur	nasiḥat	hai	Imān	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلْعَذَابِ ۚ وَلَوْلَآ أَجَلٌۭ مُّسَمًّۭى لَّجَآءَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَيَأْتِيَنَّهُم بَغْتَةًۭ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	urge	you	to	hasten	the	
punishment;	and	if	a	time	had	not	been	
fixed,	the	punishment	would	have	certainly	
come	upon	them;	and	it	will	indeed	come	
upon	them	suddenly	whilst	they	are	
unaware
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	Allāh	bas	(kāfi)	hai	mere	aur	tumhāre	darmiyān	gawāh	jāntā	hai	jo	kuch	
āasmānoñ	aur	zameen meiñ	hai	aur	woh bāṭil	par	yaqin	lāye	aur	Allāh	ke	munkir	huye	wohi	
ghāte	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: يَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلْعَذَابِ وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمُحِيطَةٌۢ بِٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	se	‘aƶāb	ki	jaldi	karte	haiñ	aur	agar	
aik	thahrāi	muddat	na	hoti	to	zaror	un	par	
‘aƶāb	āa	jātā	aur	zaror	un	par	achānak	āaye	
ga	jab	woh be-khabar	hoñ	ge.

arabicText: يَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلْعَذَابِ وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمُحِيطَةٌۢ بِٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	day	when	the	punishment	will	envelop	
them	from	above	them	and	from	below	their	
feet,	and	He	will	say,	“Taste	the	flavour	of	
your	deeds!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	se	‘aƶāb	ki	jaldi	machāte	haiñ	aur	be
shak	jahannam	ghere	huye	hai	kāfiroñ	ko.

arabicText: يَوْمَ يَغْشَىٰهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِن فَوْقِهِمْ وَمِن تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِهِمْ وَيَقُولُ ذُوقُوا۟ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	My	bondmen	who	believe!	Indeed	My	
earth	is	spacious	–	therefore	worship	Me	
alone.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	unheñ	dhāñpe	ga	‘aƶāb	un	ke	upar	
aur	un	ke	pāoñ	ke	neeche	se	aur	farmāye	ga	
chakho	apne	kiye	kā	maza.

arabicText: يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ أَرْضِى وَٰسِعَةٌۭ فَإِيَّـٰىَ فَٱعْبُدُونِ
englishTranslationText:
Every	soul	must	taste	death;	then	it	is	to	Us	
that	you	will	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	bando	jo	Imān	lāye	be-shak	meri	
zameen	wasi’a	hai	to	meri	hi	bandagi	karo.

arabicText: كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ ذَآئِقَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Every	soul	must	taste	death;	then	it	is	to	Us	
that	you	will	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	bando	jo	Imān	lāye	be-shak	meri	
zameen	wasi’a	hai	to	meri	hi	bandagi	karo.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ غُرَفًۭا تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ نِعْمَ أَجْرُ ٱلْعَـٰمِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds	–	indeed	We	will,	surely,	place	them	on	high	
positions	in	Paradise	beneath	which	rivers	
flow,	abiding	in	it	for	ever;	what	an	excellent	
reward	of	the	performers!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	
kiye	zaror	ham	unheñ	jannat	ke	bālā	khānoñ	
par	jagah	deñ	ge	jin	ke	neeche	nahreñ	bahti	
hoñ	gi	hamesha	un	meiñ	raheñ	ge	kyā	hi	
achchā	ajr	kām	wāloñ	kā.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	patiently	endured	and	who	rely	
only	upon	their	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jinhoñ	ne	sabr	kyā	aur	apne	Rab	hi	par	
bharosa	rakhte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن دَآبَّةٍۢ لَّا تَحْمِلُ رِزْقَهَا ٱللَّهُ يَرْزُقُهَا وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	par	kitne	hi	chalne	wāle	haiñ	ke	
apni	rozi	sāth	nahiñ	rakhte	Allāh	rozi	detā	
hai	unheñ	aur	tumheñ	aur	wohi	suntā	jāntā	
hai.

arabicText: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ لَيَقُولُنَّ ٱللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	ask	them,	“Who	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	and	subjected	the	sun	and	the	moon?”,	
they	will	surely	say,	“Allah”;	so	where	are	they	reverting?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	un	se	pocho	kis	ne	banāye	āasmān	aur	zameen	aur	kām	meiñ	lagāye	sooraj	aur	chānd	
to	zaror	kaheñ	ge	Allāh	ne	to	kahāñ	auñdhe	jāte	haiñ

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ وَيَقْدِرُ لَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	eases	the	sustenance	for	whomever	He	wills	among	His	bondmen,	and	restricts	it	for	
whomever	He	wills;	indeed	Allah	knows	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	kushāda	kartā	hai	rizq	apne	bandoñ	meiñ	jis	ke	liye	chāhe	aur	tangi	fermātā	hai	jis	ke	liye	
chāhe	be-shak		sab	kuch	jāntā.

arabicText: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّن نَّزَّلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَحْيَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَوْتِهَا لَيَقُولُنَّ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	ask	them,	“Who	sent	down	the	water	from	the	sky,	and	with	it	revived	the	earth	after	its	
death?”,	they	will	surely	say,	“Allah”;	proclaim,	“All	praise	is	to	Allah”;	in	fact	most	of	them	do	not	
have	any	sense.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	tum	un	se	pooñcho	kis	ne	utārā	āasmān	se	pāni	to	is	ke	sabab	zameen	zinda	kar	di	mare	piche	
zaror	kaheñ	ge	Allāh	ne	tum	farmāo	sab	khobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	balke	un	meiñ	aksar	be-áql	haiñ.

arabicText: وَمَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَآ إِلَّا لَهْوٌۭ وَلَعِبٌۭ ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱلدَّارَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ لَهِىَ ٱلْحَيَوَانُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	this	worldly	life	is	nothing	but	
pastime	and	game;	indeed	the	abode	of	
the	Hereafter	-	that	is	indeed	the	true	life;	
if	only	they	knew.
romanUrduTranslationText:
And	Aur	ye	dunyā	ki	zindagi	to	nahiñ	
magar	khel	kood	aur	be-shak	āakhirat	kā	
ghar	zaror	wohi	sachchi	zindagi	hai	kyā	
achchā	thā	agar	jānte.

arabicText: فَإِذَا رَكِبُوا۟ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ دَعَوُا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ فَلَمَّا نَجَّىٰهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْبَرِّ إِذَا هُمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	board	the	ships	they	pray	
to	Allah,	believing	purely	in	Him;	so	when	
He	delivers	them	safely	to	land,	they	
immediately	begin	ascribing	partners	(to	
Him)!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	kashhti	meiñ	sawār	hote	haiñ	
Allāh	ko	pukārte	haiñ	aik	usi	par	‘aqida	lā	
kar	phir	jab	woh	unheñ	khushki	ki	ṭaraf	
bachā	lātā	hai	jabhi	shirk	karne	lagte	haiñ.

arabicText: لِيَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ وَلِيَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	nā-shukri	kareñ	hamāri	di	huyi	
ne’amat	ki	aur	bateñ	to	ab	jānā	chāhte	
haiñ.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا حَرَمًا ءَامِنًۭا وَيُتَخَطَّفُ ٱلنَّاسُ مِنْ حَوْلِهِمْ ۚ أَفَبِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ يُؤْمِنُونَ وَبِنِعْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ يَكْفُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	they	not	observe	that	We	have	
created	a	refuge	in	the	Sacred	Land,	and	
people	around	them	are	snatched	away?	
So	do	they	believe	in	falsehood	and	are	
ungrateful	for	the	favours	of	Allah?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	unhoñ	ne	ye	na	dekhā	ke	ham	ne	
ḥurmat	wāli	zameen	panāh	banāi	aur	un	
ke	āas	pās	wāle	log	uchak	liye	jāte	haiñ	to	
kyā	bāṭil	par	yaqin	lāte	haiñ	aur	Allāh	ki	di	
huyi	ne’amat	se	nā-shukri	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِٱلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُۥٓ ۚ أَلَيْسَ فِى جَهَنَّمَ مَثْوًۭى لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	who	is	more	unjust	than	one	who	
fabricates	lies	against	Allah,	or	denies	the	
truth	*	when	it	comes	to	him?	Is	there	not	
a	place	in	hell	for	disbelievers?	(*	The	Holy	
Prophet	and	/	or	the	Holy	Qur’an).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	se	badh	kar	zālim	kaun	jo	Allāh	par	
jhot	bāndhe	ya	ḥaq	ko	jhutlāye	jab	woh	us	
ke	pās	āaye	kyā	jahannam	meiñ	kāfiroñ	kā	
thikānā	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ جَـٰهَدُوا۟ فِينَا لَنَهْدِيَنَّهُمْ سُبُلَنَا ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَمَعَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	strove	in	Our	way	-	We	
shall	surely	show	them	Our	paths;	and	
indeed	Allah	is	with	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinhoñ	ne	hamāri	rāh	meiñ	koshish	ki	
zaroor	ham	unheñ	apne	rāste	dikhā	deñ	
ge	aur	be-shak	Allāh	nekoñ	ke	sāth	hai.

arabicText: الٓمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Alif-Laam-Meem*.(*Alphabets	of	the	Arabic	language;	Allah	and	to	whomever	He	reveals,	know	
their	precise	meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Alif-Laam-Meem*.	(*Arabi	zabān	ke	Huroof	jinke	Ma’āni	Allah	aur	Jis	par	Allah	Ta’āla	ne	Inko	
Nazil	Farmaya	Wahi	Janta	hai.)

arabicText: غُلِبَتِ ٱلرُّومُ
englishTranslationText: The	Romans	have	been	defeated.
romanUrduTranslationText: Roomi	maghloob	huye.

arabicText: فِىٓ أَدْنَى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَهُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ غَلَبِهِمْ سَيَغْلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText: In	the	nearby	land,	and	after	their	defeat	they	will	soon	be	victorious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Pās	ki	zameen	meiñ	aur	apni	maghloobi	ke	b’ād	‘an-qareeb	ghālib	hoñ	ge

arabicText: فِى بِضْعِ سِنِينَ ۗ لِلَّهِ ٱلْأَمْرُ مِن قَبْلُ وَمِنۢ بَعْدُ ۚ وَيَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَفْرَحُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Within	a	few	(up	to	nine)	years	time;	only	for	Allah	is	the	command,	before	and	after;	and	the	
believers	will	rejoice	on	that	day.
romanUrduTranslationText: Chand	baras	meiñ	ḥukm	Allāh	hi	kā	hai	āage	aur	peeche	aur	us	din	Imān	wāle	khush	hoñ	ge.

arabicText: بِنَصْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ يَنصُرُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
With	the	help	of	Allah;	He	helps	whomever	He	wills;	and	only	He	is	the	Almighty,	the	Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	ki	madad	se;	woh	madad	kartā	hai	jis	ki	chāhe;	aur	wohi	hai	‘izzat	wālā	maharbān

arabicText: وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱللَّهُ وَعْدَهُۥ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	promise	of	Allah;	Allah	does	not	
renege	on	His	promise,	but	most	people	
do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	kā	w’ada	Allāh	apnā	w’ada	khilāf	
nahiñ	kata	lekin	bahut	log	nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: يَعْلَمُونَ ظَـٰهِرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ غَـٰفِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	know	only	the	visible	worldly	life;	
and	are	totally	neglectful	of	the	Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jānte	haiñ	āañkhoñ	ke	sāmne	ki	dunyawi	
zindagi	aur	woh	āakhirat	se	poore	be
khabar	haiñ.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَتَفَكَّرُوا۟ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِم ۗ مَّا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى ۗ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِلِقَآئِ رَبِّهِمْ لَكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Have	they	not	inwardly	pondered	–	that	
Allah	has	not	created	the	heavens	and	the	
earth,	and	all	that	is	between	them,	except	
with	truth	and	a	fixed	term?	And	indeed	
many	people	deny	the	meeting	with	their	
Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	unhoñ	ne	apne	ji	meiñ	na	soñchā	ke	
Allāh	ne	paidā	na	kiye	āasmān	aur	
zameen	aur	jo	kuch	un	ke	darmiyān	hai	
magar	ḥaq	aur	aik	muqarrar	mi’aād	se	aur	
be-shak	bahut	se	log	apne	rab	se	milne	kā	
inkār	rakhte	haiñ.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَانُوٓا۟ أَشَدَّ مِنْهُمْ قُوَّةًۭ وَأَثَارُوا۟ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَعَمَرُوهَآ أَكْثَرَ مِمَّا عَمَرُوهَا وَجَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ ۖ فَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيَظْلِمَهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	did	they	not	travel	in	the	land	to	see	
what	sort	of	fate	befell	those	before	them?	
They	were	stronger	than	them,	and	they	
cultivated	the	land	and	inhabited	it	more	
than	them,	and	their	Noble	Messengers	
came	to	them	with	clear	proofs;	so	it	did	
not	befit	Allah’s	Majesty	to	oppress	them,	
but	it	was	they	who	used	to	wrong	
themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	unhoñ	ne	zameen	meiñ	safar	na	
kiyā	ke	dekhte	ke	un	se	agloñ	kā	anjām	
kaisā	huā	woh	un	se	ziyāda	zor	āawar	the	
aur	zameen	joti	aur	āabād	ki	un	ki	āabādi	
se	ziyāda	aur	un	ke	Rasool	un	ke	pās	
roshan	nishāniyāñ	lāye	to	Allāh	ki	shān	na	
thi	ke	un	par	zulm	kartā	hāñ	woh	khud	hi	
apni	jānoñ	par	zulm	karte	the.

arabicText: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَـٰٓـُٔوا۟ ٱلسُّوٓأَىٰٓ أَن كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَكَانُوا۟ بِهَا يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	the	fate	of	those	who	committed	evil	
to	the	extreme	was	that	they	denied	the	
signs	of	Allah	and	used	to	mock	at	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jinhoñ	ne	ḥad	bhar	ki	burāi	ki	un	kā	
anjām	ye	huā	ke	Allāh	ki	āayateñ	jhutlāne	
lage	aur	un	ke	sāth	tamaskhur	karte.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	initiates	the	creation,	then	will	
create	it	again	-	then	it	is	to	Him	that	you	
will	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	pahle	banātā	hai	phir	dobāra	banāye	
ga	phir	us	ki	ṭaraf	phiro	ge.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ يُبْلِسُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	Day	of	Resurrection	is	
established,	the	guilty	*	will	lose	all	hope.	(*	The	disbelievers.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jis	din	qayāmat	qāim	hogi	mujrimoñ	ki	āas	tot	jāye	gi.

arabicText: وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُم مِّن شُرَكَآئِهِمْ شُفَعَـٰٓؤُا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ كَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	the	partners	they	ascribed	will	not	be	their	intercessors	-	and	they	will	deny	their	partners.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	un	ke	sharik	un	ke	sifārashi	na	hoñ	ge	aur	woh	apne	sharikoñ	se	munkir	ho	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَتَفَرَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	when	the	Day	of	Resurrection	is	established	–	that	day	they	will	all	separate.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jis	din	qayāmat	qāim	hogi	us	din	alag	ho	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَهُمْ فِى رَوْضَةٍۢ يُحْبَرُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds	–	they	will	be	hosted	in	the	Garden
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	bāgh	ki	kiyāri	meiñ	un	ki	khaṭir-dāri	hogi.

arabicText: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَلِقَآئِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ مُحْضَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	disbelieved,	and	denied	
Our	signs	and	confronting	the	Hereafter	–	
they	will	be	hauled	into	the	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	kāfir	huye	aur	Hamāri	Āyateñ	
aur	Āakhirat	kā	milnā	jhutlāyā	woh‘aƶāb	
meiñ	lā	dhare	(dale)	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: فَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ حِينَ تُمْسُونَ وَحِينَ تُصْبِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	proclaim	the	Purity	of	Allah	when	you	
witness	the	night	and	the	morning.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Allāh	ki	pāki	bolo	jab	sham	karo	aur	
jab	subḥ	ho.

arabicText: وَلَهُ ٱلْحَمْدُ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَعَشِيًّۭا وَحِينَ تُظْهِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	only	His	is	the	praise	in	the	heavens	
and	the	earth	-	and	before	the	day	ends	
and	at	noon.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Usi	ki	t’arif	hai	āamānoñ	aur	zameen	
meiñ	aur	kuch	din	rahe	aur	jab	tumheñ	
dophar	ho.

arabicText: يُخْرِجُ ٱلْحَىَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَيِّتِ وَيُخْرِجُ ٱلْمَيِّتَ مِنَ ٱلْحَىِّ وَيُحْىِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ تُخْرَجُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	brings	forth	the	living	from	the	dead,	
and	brings	forth	the	dead	from	the	living,	
and	He	revives	the	earth	after	its	death;	
and	this	how	you	will	be	raised.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wo	zinda	ko	nikāltā	hai	murde	se	aur	
murde	ko	nikāltā	hai	zinda	se	aur	zameen	
ko	jilātā	(sar	sabz	o	shādāb	kartā)	hai	us	
ke	mare	peeche	aur	yoñ	hi	tum	nikāle	jāo	
ge.

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦٓ أَنْ خَلَقَكُم مِّن تُرَابٍۢ ثُمَّ إِذَآ أَنتُم بَشَرٌۭ تَنتَشِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	that	He	created	
you	from	dust,	and	therefore	you	are	
human	beings	spread	in	the	earth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	hai	ye	ke	tumheñ	
paidā	kiyā	mitti	se	phir	jabhi	tum	insān	ho	
dunyā	meiñ	phaile	huye.

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦٓ أَنْ خَلَقَ لَكُم مِّنْ أَنفُسِكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًۭا لِّتَسْكُنُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهَا وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَكُم مَّوَدَّةًۭ وَرَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	that	He	created	
spouses	for	you	from	yourselves	for	you	
to	gain	rest	from	them,	and	kept	love	and	
mercy	between	yourselves;	indeed	in	this	
are	signs	for	the	people	who	ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	hai	ke	tumhāre	
liye	tumhāri	hi	jins	se	jode	banāye	ke	un	
se	āarām	pāo	aur	tumhāre	āapas	meiñ	
muḥabbat	aur	Raḥmat	rakhi	be-shak	is	
meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	dhiyān	karne	wāloñ	
ke	liye.

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ خَلْقُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱخْتِلَـٰفُ أَلْسِنَتِكُمْ وَأَلْوَٰنِكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّلْعَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	the	creation	of	the	
heavens	and	the	earth,	and	the	differences	
in	your	languages	and	colours;	indeed	in	
this	are	signs	for	people	who	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	hai	āasmānoñ	aur	
zamin	ki	paidāish	aur	tumhāri	zabānoñ	aur	rangatoñ	kā	ikhtilāf	be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	
jān	ne	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ مَنَامُكُم بِٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ وَٱبْتِغَآؤُكُم مِّن فَضْلِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَسْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	your	sleeping	
during	the	night	and	day,	and	your	
seeking	His	munificence;	indeed	in	this	are	signs	for	people	who	heed
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	meiñ	se	hai	rāt	aur	din	meiñ	tumhārā	sonā	aur	us	kā	fazl	talāsh	karnā	be
shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	sunne	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ يُرِيكُمُ ٱلْبَرْقَ خَوْفًۭا وَطَمَعًۭا وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَيُحْىِۦ بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَآ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	that	He	shows	you	the	lightning,	instilling	fear	and	hope,	and	sends	
down	water	from	the	sky,	so	revives	the	earth	after	its	death;	indeed	in	this	are	signs	for	people	
of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	hai	ke	tumheñ	bijli	dikhātā	hai	darāti	aur	ummid	dilāti	aur	āasmān	se	
pāni	utārtā	hai	to	us	se	zameen	ko	zinda	kartā	hai	us	ke	mare	piche	be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	
haiñ	‘aql	wāloñ	ke	liye

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦٓ أَن تَقُومَ ٱلسَّمَآءُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ بِأَمْرِهِۦ ۚ ثُمَّ إِذَا دَعَاكُمْ دَعْوَةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ إِذَآ أَنتُمْ تَخْرُجُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	that	the	heavens	
and	the	earth	remain	established	by	His	
command;	then	when	He	calls	you	-	from	
the	earth	–	you	will	thereupon	emerge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	hai	ke	us	ke	ḥukm	
se	āasmān	aur	zameen	qāim	haiñ	phir	jab	
tumheñ	zameen	se	aik	nidā	farmāye	gā	
jabhi	tum	nikal	pado	ge.

arabicText: وَلَهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ كُلٌّۭ لَّهُۥ قَـٰنِتُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	Him	only	belong	all	those	who	are	
in	the	heavens	and	the	earth;	all	are	
submissive	to	Him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usi	ke	haiñ	jo	koi	āasmānoñ	aur	
zameen	meiñ	haiñ	sab	us	ke	zer-e-ḥukm	
haiñ.

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ وَهُوَ أَهْوَنُ عَلَيْهِ ۚ وَلَهُ ٱلْمَثَلُ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	initiates	the	creation,	
and	will	then	create	it	again	-	and	this,	
according	to	you,	should	be	easier	for	
Him!	And	for	Him	only	is	the	Supreme	
Majesty	in	the	heavens	and	the	earth;	and	
only	He	is	the	Almighty,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	hai	ke	awwal	banātā	hai	phir	
use	dobāra	banāye	gā	aur	yeh	tumhāri	
samajh	meiñ	is	par	ziyāda	āasān	honā	
chāhiye	aur	usi	ke	liye	hai	sab	se	bartar	
shān	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	meiñ	aur	
wohi		‘izzat-o-ḥikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: ضَرَبَ لَكُم مَّثَلًۭا مِّنْ أَنفُسِكُمْ ۖ هَل لَّكُم مِّن مَّا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُكُم مِّن شُرَكَآءَ فِى مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ فَأَنتُمْ فِيهِ سَوَآءٌۭ تَخَافُونَهُمْ كَخِيفَتِكُمْ أَنفُسَكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لِقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	illustrates	an	example	for	you	from	
your	own	selves;	do	you	have	for	
yourselves,	among	the	bondmen	you	
possess,	partners	in	the	sustenance	We	
have	bestowed	upon	you,	thereby	you	
become	equal	in	respect	of	it	-	you	fearing	
them	the	way	you	fear	each	other?	This	is	
how	We	illustrate	detailed	signs	for	the	
people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāre	liye	aik	kahāwat	bayān	farmātā	
hai	khud	tumhāre	apne	ḥāl	se	kyā	
tumhāre	liye	tumhāre	hath	ke	māl	
ghulāmoñ	meiñ	se	kuch	sharik	haiñ	us	
meiñ	jo	ham	ne	tumheñ	rozi	di	to	tum	sab	
us	meiñ	barābar	ho	tum	un	se	daro	jaise	
āapas	meiñ	aik	dosre	se	darte	ho	ham	aisi	
mufassal	nishānyāñ	bayān	farmāte	haiñ	
‘aql	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: بَلِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُم بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍۢ ۖ فَمَن يَهْدِى مَنْ أَضَلَّ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Rather	the	unjust	followed	their	own	
desires,	without	knowledge;	so	who	can	
guide	one	whom	Allah	has	sent	astray?	
And	they	do	not	have	supporters.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	zālim	apni	khwāhishoñ	ke	piche	ho	
liye	be	jāne	to	use	kaun	hidāyat	kare	jise	
khudā	ne	gumrāh	kiyā	aur	un	kā	koi	madadgār	nahiñ.

arabicText: فَأَقِمْ وَجْهَكَ لِلدِّينِ حَنِيفًۭا ۚ فِطْرَتَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّتِى فَطَرَ ٱلنَّاسَ عَلَيْهَا ۚ لَا تَبْدِيلَ لِخَلْقِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلدِّينُ ٱلْقَيِّمُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	set	your	attention	for	obeying	
Allah,	devoted	solely	to	Him;	the	foundation	set	by	Allah,	upon	which	He	created	man;	do	not	
change	what	Allah	has	created;	this	is	the	proper	religion	-	but	most	people	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apnā	moñh	seedha	karo	Allāh	ki	iṭā’at	ke	liye	aik	akele	usi	ke	ho	kar	Allāh	ki	dāli	huyi	binā	jis	
par	logoñ	ko	paidā	kiyā	Allāh	ki	banāi	cheez	na	badalnā	yahi	seedha	deen	hai	magar	bahut	log	
nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: ۞ مُنِيبِينَ إِلَيْهِ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Inclining	towards	Him	-	and	fear	Him,	and	keep	the	prayer	established,	and	never	be	of	the	
polytheists.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ki	ṭaraf	ruja’	lāte	huye	aur	us	se	daro	aur	namāz	qāim	rakho	aur	mushrikoñ	se	na	ho.

arabicText: مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ فَرَّقُوا۟ دِينَهُمْ وَكَانُوا۟ شِيَعًۭا ۖ كُلُّ حِزْبٍۭ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	broke	their	religion	into	several	parts	and	became	different	groups;	every	group	is	
happy	with	what	it	has.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	meiñ	se	jinhoñ	ne	apne	deen	ko	tukde-tukde	kar	diyā	aur	ho	gaye	giroh-giroh	har	giroh	jo	us	
ke	pās	hai	us	par	khush	hai.

arabicText: وَإِذَا مَسَّ ٱلنَّاسَ ضُرٌّۭ دَعَوْا۟ رَبَّهُم مُّنِيبِينَ إِلَيْهِ ثُمَّ إِذَآ أَذَاقَهُم مِّنْهُ رَحْمَةً إِذَا فَرِيقٌۭ مِّنْهُم بِرَبِّهِمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	some	affliction	reaches	men,	
they	pray	to	their	Lord	inclining	towards	
Him	–	and	when	He	gives	them	a	taste	of	
His	mercy,	thereupon	a	group	among	
them	begins	setting	up	partners	to	their	
Lord!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	logoñ	ko	taklif	pahuñchti	hai	to	
apne	Rab	ko	pukārte	haiñ	us	ki	ṭaraf	ruju’		
lāte	huye	phir	jab	woh	unheñ	apne	pās	se	
Raḥmat	kā	maza	detā	hai	jabhi	un	meiñ	se	
aik	giroh	apne	Rab	kā	shareek	thahrāne	
lagtā	hai.

arabicText: لِيَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ ۚ فَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	order	to	be	ungrateful	for	Our	
bestowal;	“Therefore	enjoy”;	you	will	
soon	come	to	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ki	hamāre	diye	ki	nā-shukri	kareñ	to	
barat	lo	ab	qarib	jānnā	chāhte	ho.

arabicText: أَمْ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَـٰنًۭا فَهُوَ يَتَكَلَّمُ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	have	We	sent	down	to	them	any	proof,	
which	therefore	tells	them	of	My	
partners?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yā	ham	ne	un	par	koi	sanad	utāri	ke	woh	
unheñ	hamāre	sharik	batā	rahi	hai.

arabicText: وَإِذَآ أَذَقْنَا ٱلنَّاسَ رَحْمَةًۭ فَرِحُوا۟ بِهَا ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْهُمْ سَيِّئَةٌۢ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ إِذَا هُمْ يَقْنَطُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	We	give	people	the	taste	of	
mercy	they	rejoice	at	it;	and	if	an	ill	
fortune	reaches	them	because	of	what	
their	hands	have	sent	ahead	-	thereupon	
they	lose	hope!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	ham	logoñ	ko	Raḥmat	kā	maza	
dete	haiñ	is	par	khush	ho	jāte	haiñ	aur	
agar	unheñ	koi	burāi	pahuñche	badla	us	
kā	jo	un	ke	hāthoñ	ne	bhejā	jabhi	woh	nā
ummid	ho	jāte	haiñ.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَبْسُطُ ٱلرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقْدِرُ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	did	they	not	see	that	Allah	eases	the	
sustenance	for	whomever	He	wills	and	
restricts	it	for	whomever	He	wills?	Indeed	
in	this	are	signs	for	people	who	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	unhoñ	ne	na	dekhā	ke	Allāh	rizq	
wasi’	farmātā	hai	jis	ke	liye	chāhe	aur	
tangi	farmātā	hai	jis	ke	liye	chāhe	be-shak	
is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	Imān	wāloñ	ke	
liye.

arabicText: فَـَٔاتِ ذَا ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ حَقَّهُۥ وَٱلْمِسْكِينَ وَٱبْنَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌۭ لِّلَّذِينَ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	give	the	relative	his	right,	and	
to	the	needy,	and	to	the	traveller;	this	is	
better	for	those	who	seek	the	pleasure	of	
Allah;	and	it	is	they	who	are	the	
successful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	rishtedār	ko	us	kā	ḥaq	do	aur	miskeen	
aur	musāfir	ko	ye	behtar	hai	un	ke	liye	jo	
Allāh	ki	razā	chāhte	haiñ	aur	unhiñ	kā	
kām	banā.

arabicText: وَمَآ ءَاتَيْتُم مِّن رِّبًۭا لِّيَرْبُوَا۟ فِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِ ٱلنَّاسِ فَلَا يَرْبُوا۟ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَمَآ ءَاتَيْتُم مِّن زَكَوٰةٍۢ تُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَ ٱللَّهِ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُضْعِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	that	which	you	give	upon	usury,	in	
order	that	it	may	increase	the	creditors’	
property,	will	not	increase	before	Allah;	and	the	charity	you	give	seeking	the	pleasure	of	Allah	–	
only	that	will	increase	manifold.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	jo	cheez	ziyāda	lene	ko	do	ke	dene	wāle	ke	māl	badheñ	to	woh	Allāh	ke	yahāñ	na	badhe	
gi	aur	jo	tum	khairāt	do	Allāh	ki	razā	chāhte	huye	to	unhiñ	ke	doone	haiñ

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ ثُمَّ رَزَقَكُمْ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُحْيِيكُمْ ۖ هَلْ مِن شُرَكَآئِكُم مَّن يَفْعَلُ مِن ذَٰلِكُم مِّن شَىْءٍۢ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ وَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	created	you	and	then	provided	you	sustenance,	then	will	cause	you	to	die,	and	
will	then	give	you	life	again;	is	there	any	among	your	ascribed	partners	that	can	do	any	of	these	
things?	Purity	and	Supremacy	are	to	Him,	above	their	ascribing	of	partners	(to	Him)!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	tumheñ	paidā	kiyā	phir	tumheñ	rozi	di	phir	tumheñ	māre	ga	phir	tumheñ	jilāye	
(zinda	kare)	ga	kyā	tumhāre	sharikoñ	meiñ	bhi	koi	aisā	hai	jo	un	kāmoñ	meiñ	se	kuch	kare	pāki	
aur	bartari	hai	usey	un	ke	shirk	se.

arabicText: ظَهَرَ ٱلْفَسَادُ فِى ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ أَيْدِى ٱلنَّاسِ لِيُذِيقَهُم بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى عَمِلُوا۟ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Chaos	appears	in	the	land	and	the	sea	because	of	the	evil	deeds	which	people’s	hands	have	
earned,	in	order	to	make	them	taste	the	flavour	of	some	of	their	misdeeds	–	in	order	that	they	
may	come	back.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Chamki	kharābi	khushki	aur	tari	meiñ	un	burāiyoñ	se	jo	logoñ	ke	hāthoñ	ne	kamāyiñ	take	
unheñ	un	ke	b'az	kotakoñ(bure	kāmoñ)	kā	maza	chakhāye	kahiñ	woh	b’az	āayeñ.

arabicText: قُلْ سِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“Travel	
in	the	land,	and	see	what	sort	of	fate	befell	
the	former	people;	and	most	of	them	were	
polytheists.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	zameen	meiñ	chal	kar	dekho	
kaisā	anjām	huā	agloñ	kā	un	meiñ	bahut	
mushrik	the.

arabicText: فَأَقِمْ وَجْهَكَ لِلدِّينِ ٱلْقَيِّمِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِىَ يَوْمٌۭ لَّا مَرَدَّ لَهُۥ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَصَّدَّعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	set	your	attention	for	worship,	
before	the	day	from	Allah	which	cannot	
be	averted	-	on	that	day	people	will	be	
split,	separated.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apnā	moñh	siddha	kar	'ibādat	ke	liye	
qabl	is	ke	ke	woh	din	āaye	jise	Allāh	ki	
ṭaraf	se	talnā	nahiñ	us	din	alag	phat	jāyeñ	
ge.

arabicText: مَن كَفَرَ فَعَلَيْهِ كُفْرُهُۥ ۖ وَمَنْ عَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَلِأَنفُسِهِمْ يَمْهَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	disbelieves,	then	the	calamity	of	
his	disbelief	is	only	on	him;	and	those	who	
do	good	deeds,	are	preparing	for	
themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	kufr	kare	us	ke	kufr	kā	wabāl	usi	par	
aur	jo	achchā	kām	kareñ	woh	apne	hi	liye	
tayyāri	kar	rahe	haiñ.

arabicText: لِيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ مِن فَضْلِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Take	sila	de	unheñ	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	
achche	kām	kiye	apne	fazl	se	be-shak	wo	
kāfiroñ	ko	dost	nahiñ	rakhtā.

arabicText: وَمِنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦٓ أَن يُرْسِلَ ٱلرِّيَاحَ مُبَشِّرَٰتٍۢ وَلِيُذِيقَكُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ وَلِتَجْرِىَ ٱلْفُلْكُ بِأَمْرِهِۦ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	among	His	signs	is	that	He	sends	
winds	heralding	glad	tidings,	to	make	you	
taste	His	mercy,	and	so	that	the	ships	may	
sail	by	His	command,	and	so	that	you	may	
seek	His	munificence,	and	for	you	to	give	
thanks.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	hai	ke	hawāyeñ	
bhejtā	hai	muzda	sunāti	aur	is	liye	ke	
tumheñ	apni	Raḥmat	kā	ƶāiqa	de	aur	is	
liye	ke	kashti	us	ke	ḥukm	se	chale	aur	is	
liye	ke	us	kā	fazl	talāsh	karo	aur	is	liye	ke	
tum	ḥaq	māno.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ رُسُلًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِمْ فَجَآءُوهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ ۖ وَكَانَ حَقًّا عَلَيْنَا نَصْرُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	sent	several	Noble	
Messengers	before	you,	to	their	nations	–	
so	they	came	to	them	with	clear	signs	-	
We	therefore	took	revenge	from	the	
guilty;	and	it	is	incumbent	upon	Our	
mercy,	to	help	the	Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	tum	se	pahle	kitne	
Rasool	un	ki	qaum	ki	ṭaraf	bheje	to	woh	
un	ke	pās	khuli	nishāniyāñ	lāye	phir	ham	
ne	mujrimoñ	se	badla	liyā	aur	hamāre	
ƶimma-e-karam	par	hai	Musalmānoñ	ki	
madad	farmānā.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ فَتُثِيرُ سَحَابًۭا فَيَبْسُطُهُۥ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيْفَ يَشَآءُ وَيَجْعَلُهُۥ كِسَفًۭا فَتَرَى ٱلْوَدْقَ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ خِلَـٰلِهِۦ ۖ فَإِذَآ أَصَابَ بِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦٓ إِذَا هُمْ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	sends	the	winds	raising	
the	clouds	-	therefore	spreads	them	in	the	sky	as	He	wills	and	shatters	them	–	so	you	see	the	
rain	dropping	from	inside	it;	so	when	He	delivers	it	upon	whomever	He	wills	among	His	
bondmen,	thereupon	they	rejoice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	ke	bhejtā	hai	hawāyeñ	ke	ubhārti	haiñ	bādal	phir	use	phailā	detā	hai	āasmān	meiñ	
jaisā	chāhe	aur	usey	pāra	pāra	kartā	hai	to	tu	dekhe	ke	us	ke	beech	meiñ	se	minh	nikal	rahā	hai	
phir	jab	use	pahuñchātā	hai	apne	bandoñ	meiñ	jis	ki	ṭaraf	chāhe	jabhi	woh	khushiyāñ	manāte	
haiñ.

arabicText: وَإِن كَانُوا۟ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يُنَزَّلَ عَلَيْهِم مِّن قَبْلِهِۦ لَمُبْلِسِينَ
englishTranslationText: Although	they	had	lost	hope	before	it	was	sent	down	upon	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Agarche	us	ke	utārne	se	pahle	āas	tode	huye	the.

arabicText: فَٱنظُرْ إِلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِ رَحْمَتِ ٱللَّهِ كَيْفَ يُحْىِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَآ ۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَمُحْىِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	observe	the	result	of	Allah’s	mercy,	how	He	revives	the	earth	after	its	death;	He	will	
indeed	resurrect	the	dead;	and	He	is	Able	to	do	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Allāh	ki	Raḥmat	ke	asar	dekho	kyuñ	kar	zameen	ko	jilātā	(sar-sabz	kartā)	hai	us	ke	mare	
piche	be-shak	woh	murdoñ	ko	zinda	kare	ga	aur	woh	sab	kuch	kar	saktā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَئِنْ أَرْسَلْنَا رِيحًۭا فَرَأَوْهُ مُصْفَرًّۭا لَّظَلُّوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ يَكْفُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	send	a	wind	and	they	see	their	
fields	yellow	because	of	it,	then	indeed	
they	would	become	ungrateful	after	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	koi	hawā	bhejeñ	jis	se	woh	
kheti	ko	zard	dekheñ	to	zaror	us	ke	b'ad	
na-shukri	karne	lageñ.

arabicText: فَإِنَّكَ لَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَلَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْا۟ مُدْبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
For	you	do	not	make	the	dead	hear	nor	
make	the	deaf	hear	the	call	when	they	
flee,	turning	back.	(The	disbelievers	are	
referred	to	as	dead	and	deaf.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	liye	ke	tum	murdoñ	ko	nahiñ	sunāte	aur	
na	bahroñ	ko	pukārnā	sunāo	jab	woh	
peeth	de	kar	phireñ.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَنتَ بِهَـٰدِ ٱلْعُمْىِ عَن ضَلَـٰلَتِهِمْ ۖ إِن تُسْمِعُ إِلَّا مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَهُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Nor	do	you	guide	the	blind	out	of	their	
error;	you	only	make	those	hear	who	
believe	in	Our	signs,	so	they	have	
submitted.	(The	disbelievers	are	referred	
to	as	blind.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	na	tum	andhoñ	ko	un	ki	gumrāhi	se	
rāh	par	lāo	tum	to	usi	ko	sunāte	ho	jo	
Hamāri	Āayatoñ	par	Imān	lāye	to	woh	
gardan	rakhe	huye	haiñ.

arabicText: ۞ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُم مِّن ضَعْفٍۢ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ضَعْفٍۢ قُوَّةًۭ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ قُوَّةٍۢ ضَعْفًۭا وَشَيْبَةًۭ ۚ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْقَدِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	created	you	weak,	then	
after	weakness	gave	you	strength,	then	
after	strength	gave	you	weakness	and	old	
age;	He	creates	whatever	He	wills;	and	
only	He	is	the	All	Knowing,	the	Able.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	tumheñ	ibtidā	meiñ	
kamzor	banāyā	phir	tumheñ	nātawāni	se	
ṭāqat	bakhshi	phir	quwwat	ke	b'ad	
kamzori	aur	budhāpā	diyā	banātā	hai	jo	
chāhe	aur	wohi	'ilm-o-qudrat	wālā	hai

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ يُقْسِمُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ مَا لَبِثُوا۟ غَيْرَ سَاعَةٍۢ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ كَانُوا۟ يُؤْفَكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	Day	of	Resurrection	is	
established,	the	guilty	will	swear	that	they	
did	not	stay	except	for	an	hour;	this	is	
how	they	keep	straying.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	Qayāmat	qāim	hogi	mujrim	
qasam	khāyeñ	ge	ke	na	rahe	the	magar	aik	
ghadi	wo	aise	hi	auñdhe	jāte	the.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ وَٱلْإِيمَـٰنَ لَقَدْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِى كِتَـٰبِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْبَعْثِ ۖ فَهَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْبَعْثِ وَلَـٰكِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	said	those	who	received	knowledge	
and	faith,	“You	have	indeed	stayed	in	the	
decree	of	Allah	until	the	Day	of	
Restoration;	so	this	is	the	Day	of	
Restoration,	but	you	did	not	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	woh	jin	ko	'ilm	aur	Imān	milā	be
shak	tum	rahe	Allāh	ke	likhe	huye	meiñ	
uthne	ke	din	tak	to	ye	hai	woh	din	uthne	
kā	lekin	tum	na	jānte	the.

arabicText: فَيَوْمَئِذٍۢ لَّا يَنفَعُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مَعْذِرَتُهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُسْتَعْتَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	on	that	day	the	unjust	will	not	benefit	
from	their	excuses,	nor	will	anyone	ask	them	for	compensation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	din	zālimoñ	ko	nafa'	na	de	gi	un	ki	
m'azarat	aur	na	un	se	koi	rāzi	karnā	mañge.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ضَرَبْنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِى هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍۢ ۚ وَلَئِن جِئْتَهُم بِـَٔايَةٍۢ لَّيَقُولَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا مُبْطِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	have	illustrated	all	kinds	of	examples	in	this	Qur’an	for	mankind;	and	indeed	if	
you	bring	a	sign	to	them,	the	disbelievers	will	say,	“You	are	upon	nothing	but	falsehood.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	logoñ	ke	liye	is	qur’ān	meiñ	har	qism	ki	misal	bayān	farmāyiñ	aur	agar	tum	
un	ke	pās	koi	nishāni	lāo	to	zaror	kāfir	kaheñ	ge	tum	to	nahiñ	magar	bāṭil	par.

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText: This	is	how	Allah	sets	seal	upon	the	hearts	of	the	ignorant.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yuñ	hi	muhar	kar	detā	hai	Allāh	jāhiloñ	ke	diloñ	par.

arabicText: فَٱصْبِرْ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَخِفَّنَّكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	patiently	endure,	indeed	the	promise	of	Allah	is	true;	and	may	not	those	who	do	not	
have	faith	make	you	impatient.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	sabr	karo	be-shak	Allāh	kā	w'ada	sachchā	hai	aur	tumheñ	sabuk	nā	kar	deñ	woh	jo	yaqeen	
nahiñ	rakhte.

arabicText: الٓمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Meem*.(*Alphabets of the 
Arabic language; Allah and to whomever 
He reveals, know their precise 
meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Meem*.	
(*Arabi zabān ke Huroof jinke Ma’āni 
Allah aur Jis par Allah Ta’āla ne Inko 
Nazi Farmaya Wahi Janta hai.)

arabicText: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
englishTranslationText: These	are	verses	of	the	wise	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ye	ḥikmat	wāli	Kitāb	ki	Āayateñ	haiñ.

arabicText: هُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةًۭ لِّلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: Guidance	and	mercy	for	the	righteous
romanUrduTranslationText: Hidāyat	aur	Raḥmat	haiñ	nekoñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	keep	the	prayer	established	
and	pay	the	charity	and	accept	faith	in	the	
Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	Namāz	qaim	rakheñ	aur	Zakat	deñ	
aur	āakhirat	par	yaqin	lāyeñ.

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَلَىٰ هُدًۭى مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	they	who	are	on	guidance	from	their	
Lord,	and	only	they	are	the	successful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	apne	rab	ki	hidāyat	par	haiñ	aur	
unhiñ	kā	kām	banā.

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَشْتَرِى لَهْوَ ٱلْحَدِيثِ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍۢ وَيَتَّخِذَهَا هُزُوًا ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ مُّهِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	some	people	buy	words	of	play,	in	
order	to	mislead	from	Allah’s	path,	
without	knowledge;	and	to	make	it	an	
article	of	mockery;	for	them	is	a	
disgraceful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kuch	log	khel	ki	bāt	kharidte	haiñ	ke	
Allāh	ki	rāh	se	bahkā	deñ	be	samjhe	aur	
use	hañsi	banā	leñ	un	ke	liye	ƶillat	kā	ázāb	
hai.

arabicText: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا وَلَّىٰ مُسْتَكْبِرًۭا كَأَن لَّمْ يَسْمَعْهَا كَأَنَّ فِىٓ أُذُنَيْهِ وَقْرًۭا ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Our	verses	are	recited	to	him	
he	haughtily	turns	away	as	if	he	did	not	
hear	them	-	as	if	there	is	deafness	in	his	
ears;	so	give	him	the	glad	tidings	of	a	
painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	us	par	Hamāri	Āayateñ	padhi	
jāyeñ	to	takabbur	kartā	huā	phire	jaise	
unheñ	sunā	hi	nahiñ	jaise	us	ke	kānoñ	
meiñ	theñt	(ruyi)	hai	to	usey	dardnāk	
'aƶāb	kā	muzda	do.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds	–	for	them	are	Gardens	of	serenity.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	
un	ke	liye	chain	ke	bāgh	haiñ.

arabicText: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقًّۭا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText: In	which	they	will	abide;	it	is	a	true	promise	of	Allah;	and	only	He	is	the	Almighty,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hamesha	un	meiñ	raheñ	ge	Allāh	kā	w'ada	hai	sachchā	aur	wohi	'izzat-o-ḥikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ بِغَيْرِ عَمَدٍۢ تَرَوْنَهَا ۖ وَأَلْقَىٰ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ رَوَٰسِىَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِكُمْ وَبَثَّ فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ دَآبَّةٍۢ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۢ كَرِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
He	created	the	heavens	without	any	supports	visible	to	you,	and	cast	mountains	as	anchors	into	
the	earth	so	that	it	may	not	shake	with	you,	and	spread	all	kinds	of	beasts	in	it;	and	We	sent	
down	water	from	the	sky	so	thereby	grew	all	kinds	of	refined	pairs	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ne	āasmān	banāye	be	aise	sutoonoñ	ke	jo	tumheñ	nazar	āayeñ	aur	zameen	meiñ	dale	langar	
ke	tumheñ	le	kar	na	kāñpe	aur	is	meiñ	har	qism	ke	jānwar	phailāye	aur	ham	ne	āasmān	se	pāni	
utārā	to	zameen	meiñ	har	nafis	joda	ugāyā.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا خَلْقُ ٱللَّهِ فَأَرُونِى مَاذَا خَلَقَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن دُونِهِۦ ۚ بَلِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	has	created	this	–	therefore	show	me	what	has	been	created	by	those	other	than	Him;	in	
fact	the	unjust	are	in	open	error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	to	Allāh	kā	banāyā	huā	hai	mujhe	woh	dikhāo	jo	us	ke	siwā	auroñ	ne	banāyā	balke	zālim	
khuli	gumrāhi	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا لُقْمَـٰنَ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ أَنِ ٱشْكُرْ لِلَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَشْكُرْ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	bestowed	wisdom	to	
Luqman	(saying)	that,	“Be	grateful	to	
Allah”;	and	whoever	is	grateful,	is	grateful	
for	his	own	good;	and	whoever	is	
ungrateful	–	then	indeed	Allah	is	the	
Absolute,	the	Most	Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	Luqmān	ko	ḥikmat	
'aṭā	farmāyi	ke	Allāh	kā	shukr	kar	aur	jo	
shukr	kare	woh	apne	bhale	ko	shukr	kartā	
hai	aur	jo	na-shukri	kare	to		be-shak	Allāh	
be	parwāh	hai	sab	khobiyoñ	sarāhā.
